caption.p: CESM simulations of the response of the global dust emission rate to future climate change. Shown are changes in the 25-year running average of the global dust emission rate relative to the period 1976–2000, as a function of global surface temperature change Δ T, simulated using CLM with the BASE and PHYS dust modules. The dashed lines denote linear least-squares fits. The additional dust emission physics in the PHYS module almost doubles the dust cycle’s response to climate change
